review: OK - so I was starving... maybe I should have gotten to CPK  prior to my blood sugar level dropping through the floor.. any way... it was my me,  - my wife and son - We ordered the Hawaiian pizza and the Meat lovers one ------ both pizza's were sopping wet in the middle - yuck, i just don't get why they let that happen - especially if the name indicates yo do pizza right -   our waitress was so slow I almost molded while waiting for her to deliver our food and refill our drinks.  - to make a long story even longer... ok just kidding .. the bottom line is our bill was 30 bucks for two wet soggy pizza's and bad service---- i wont be back and look for better places

Yeah this place is okay. Great for kids, but no reservations taken and it's first come first serve. I would never wait more than 20 minutes here . . . not THAT good! They do have a ton of items on the menu to choose from, which is nice if you're not in the mood for pizza. Also a full bar which is important for us parents!

Disappointing service.  My daughter and two friends stopped for lunch at this location today.  Maybe the server, a woman named Mayra, wrote them off because they were 14- and 15-year olds.  I am not sure.  But as paying customers they deserved better treatment.  All three young ladies said the server appeared happy and friendly at the tables around them, but definitely had a changed demeanor when at their table.  She did not provide refills of water or drinks, did not ask how their meal was, took her time coming back for anything at their table, and had another server or cook bring out their orders.  This was around 2pm so the restaurant was not busy. This is our neighborhood CPK, which my daughter and I have visited on previous occasions, and I had never had bad service here before.  But I am extremely disappointed at the lack of respect shown today to my daughter and her friends.

The pizza here was okay, and while I wouldn't say it was horrible I also wouldn't say it was anything that would make me want to come here again and again and again. The service was what you'd expect and the mango iced tea was pretty good. As a side note : I'm not a fan of thin crust pizza, but something that really annoyed me is they charge extra to get it as a thin crust. You're getting less pizza, but yet paying more for it.
CPK used to be my families favorite lunch destination. That was until they recently changed their pizza recipes. They are horrible now and we will never go back.
Dallas has so many options that a standard experience is a waste. Service was slow and food was hardly even put together. Bread was stale. Not going back

Overall I give CPK 4 stars because I absolutely LOVE their white pizza with bacon, their pesto penne, and their butter cake (oh my, that cake is the stuff dreams are made of). The three stars is due to our most recent experience, which is memorialized for all time (or until I edit after a return visit) below: My husband and I had a pretty frustrating experience the last time we visited this location, and we haven't been able to bring ourselves to return. My eye starts to twitch when we mention it. Just to tell the tale brings back unpleasant memories... Our server was a very sweet young twenty-something, but oh so forgetful - she forgot to put in part of our order, then once it was in, my pizza came out wrong and had to be re-done. While I waited for my pizza, I asked for her to bring out a quick appetizer, which never came.... because she forgot to put it in. My pizza finally came and was great, but my husband had finished his by then. Both our glasses were dry more often than they were full. To conclude, we tried the new salted caramel pudding, but it came out without whipped cream (they were out..?) We got a butter cake to go just because the pudding was so sad in comparison, and my taste buds were not satisfied. In the end, our dear little waitress said the manager was going to take care of one of our pizzas due to all of the issues, which was so nice and we were very  appreciative (we aren't the types to gripe about anything to get free food - we just don't come back - so it was great they recognized that they had provided pretty poor service and wanted to try to make it up to us). In our minds, all was set right. After a LONG while, she brought the check, but it was for the wrong table (a HUGE table, like $100 difference between our tab and theirs). We smiled, and just gave her our card to save another trip, and asked her to go ahead and swipe it for the correct tab. Unfortunately, our correct ticket did not have a comped pizza... Sad face. After being so pleasantly surprised by the idea of a free pizza, it was such a let down. And at that point we really just felt so bad for the girl (bless her heart, seriously) and didn't dare ask for it to be corrected and end up having to wait another 30 minutes. So we kept the check as it was. The hubs and I are both past servers ourselves, so we always tip well... but tipping on both pizzas, plus a to go butter cake, after some of the worst service we have ever had, left a bad taste in our mouths. It was a lesson in showing grace! So... big sigh...  Basically, the food at every CPK chain has been consistent for me over the years, and I love the butter cake - so we'll be back. I just need a little time to forget that, shudder, nails-on-chalkboard experience. Writing this review probably just set me back another two months. Twitch twitch.

It's got that closed in, slightly grimy feeling I get at Denny's and Chuck E Cheese. Like too many large sweaty men and messy kids have sat in the same booth before you, but you can't really see the damage because of the poor lighting. Ok, that being said, I'm still addicted to their pizza. Sometimes the food is great and sometimes it's gawd-awful. The same goes for the servers. Why I keep going back- the habanero carnitas pizza, the pear and gorgonzola pizza, the guacamole and corn trio, avocado egg rolls, peach tea.

Staring the meal off with sobe lean drink mixed with blood orange. Blueberries.  Etc. Then had fried mac n cheese. Little bits of fried goodness with mac n cheese insides.  The pizza i got was like pizza then they threw a salad on top, the description was awesome the outcome not so much.  Everything as great up tunilt the pizza i ordered.  Kinda disappointed since i figured pizza was their specialty :(

CPK! I love you, but this past weekend I did not love your takeout service.   My dad and I waited to order at the restaurant itself so we could take our time looking over the menu and enjoy a drink. The servers were friendly and let us have plenty of time to decide what we wanted.  I ordered my go-to favorite California Club pizza on a wheat crust with a side of alfredo sauce and my pop got the Sicilian pizza.  It only took about 20 minutes for the order to come through and we were on our merry 3 minute drive back to the hotel to enjoy. My dad will eat anything and lets no food go to waste so of course he polished off his pie, but not to supreme enjoyment. My pizza was cold, somewhat dry,and the crust was tough. The side of alfredo sauce was also forgotten in the bag which potentially could have helped with the dry taste. I won't let this experience tarnish my love for CPK too much. However, I will be weary to ever order takeout here again.

Decor: 3.5/5 -two levels of seating with your choice of booth, tables or bar.  -Booths can fit 6 to 7 adults. Booths were comfortable -Open kitchen view Service: 5/5 -overall impressed. We ordered two pies but one was burnt. The server told us another would be made because it was their mistake. The manager ended up serving the remake pie. Could it be because we accidentally left our Yelp Elite name tags on? Oops. Food: 4/5 -White Corn Guac + Chips ($4): as you can tell from the price, you get an equivalent size of guac. Fairly small but we still split between five -Avocado Club Egg Rolls ($10) came in six pieces and these were piping hot and fresh. Great flavor combination. Must try! -Original BBQ Chicken is a classic and must ($13). If you're a cilantro fan, you'll be in heaven. This pie was much much better than the Meat Lovers. -The Meat Lovers ($14) was made twice. First one was burnt, which I ended up liking more than the second. The toppings on the second wasn't cooked as well done and the crust was still doughy.

Food was just ok - pricey for the quality.  I've had better artichoke dip - tasted like it was pre-packaged.   Big mistake.  Ambiance was strange. They stuck our party of four in a booth in the corner facing the street that was so cramped I could not breathe or lift my arms.  The guy across the table kept on apologizing because his feet smacked mine constantly.  The restaurant was not packed and still they sat us there.   I don't get it.  Unfortunately, I did not pick the place and we were meeting some new friends for the first time so I didn't want to cause a scene and request a change of table.  In any case, not enough stars to recommend to anyone I know.

So I end up here as my default for when I'm meeting someone who works in Addison for lunch. I used to love this place but during my most recent visit, I saw that the menu has changed and we'll... for me, it didn't make huge improvements. The fresh corn/avocado appetizer is really a one person option. I usually get the Mexican pizza which really a fancy tostada. You gotta ask for extra salsa because they don't give you enough. The Thai salad is really really good. So pluses... Plenty of vegetarian options and they accommodate for gluten-free!

Pretty standard CPK. Always tasty goods. Had the hummus, yummy. Salad was excellent  with grilled peaches and grilled chicken!  Now...read carefully. ORDER THE BUTTER CAKE WITH ICE CREAM. This is a must. You need this.  Bonus: waiter looked like a Ken doll. Adorable!

This place has great customer service! Our Meat lovers pizza came out burnt (looked and tasted normal to us!) so they comped it and brought out another pizza that was apparently cooked properly.They were both pretty good - a little heavy on the onions though.  I like their avocado club egg rolls. They're surprisingly good. My favorite pizza here is their BBQ Chicken. The flavors worked for me and I enjoyed it. Their club pizza is okay, their BBQ one is better.  I've been here a few times and although it's a chain, it's not bad if you know what to order. :)
Great management staff. Good pizza. They only have one size of pie, keep that in mind!

I held off on writing this review for a couple of weeks, as we had some significant issues with the dinner. With that said I cannot recollect an instance where a management team took a more proactive approach to correct the wrongs and ensure guest satisfaction.  The dinner: If you haven't been to this location there's a parking structure around the corner where you come in through the back stairwell and have to hunt to find the front of the restaurant.  After getting to the front we were relatively quickly seated. The server came by relatively quickly with water and then took quite some time to bring the bread and olive oil. After taking some time ourselves and thinking what we would like to have we ended up deciding to split two entrées. The reason it took so long was they had a loyalty program on the table but you couldn't just fill out the card you had to complete an online form in order to utilize the loyalty program. This caused us to change our order several times as we thought through what we'd like to eat.  David our waiter took our order to the kitchen.   The problem: We asks for both dishes to be split one being a salad the other being a pizza that we were going to have after we completed the salad. After about 15 minutes the salad and pizza came out at the same time without being split. We knew that David had taken the order correctly however it just was not communicated to the kitchen. As we were both kind of frustrated at that point we stated out loud that we were probably not coming back to this restaurant.  Next: This is where the manager Jennifer jumped in. She right away took the pizza back and said that they were going to cook us a fresh new one. A minute later our old pizza came right back to the table. My guest and I were both extremely disappointed. Jennifer seeing this came back toward table instantly took the pizza back and apologized.  Resolution: In the end Jennifer took the pizza off the tab gave us a fresh new one and boxed up the other one for us to take home.   So you might ask how can I possibly be giving this place four stars.... First: They worked harder to make up for their service issues than any other time I've had a dinner out, not an over comp, just making things right.  Second: Ultimately the food was fantastic!! The California Fields salad with strawberries and watermelon was refreshing delicious crisp sweet crunchy with the nuts just a fantastic dining experience. The wild mushroom pizza was buttery yummy cheesy  with crisp pizza dough exactly what you want when you order a gourmet style pizza. The drinks which were a little bit overpriced were delicious. The strawberry rhubarb martini had the heart yet sweet qualities that you want in a martini especially one that is fruit based. The mai tai was divine and I would strongly recommend that drink.  No this was not my best dining experience but at the end of the day people are human and will make mistakes. Seeing how this restaurant made up for those mistakes the quality of the food and the overall effort put forth deserves the recognition of four stars.

I was craving pizza and CPK was a satisfying choice. I like very few pizzas and this one is one of the better places out there. It can be pricey in my opinion. I ordered the BBQ chicken with Pineapples. It had just the right amount of taste and flavor to it. The dough itself is on the thinner side but that is just my opinion.  Overall, not bad but not my absolute favorite! I'd recommend trying this place out to others.

I am a native Texan and visiting family here in Dallas, I use to know the owners at CPK and regularly visited. The owners have since sold the place and as not much has changed. The pizza is still awesome and the waitress was friendly, continuously checking on our table. I ordered a BBQ pizza and an avocado and BBQ salad, it was yummy. Like I said I use to know the owners, so I think I use to regularly visit the place due to my loyalty and not the food. I gave it 4 stars because it is not the greatest pizza I've had but it's  better than average, it must have been the comrdery that kept me coming.

We had a great lunch at CPK today. I had the delicious two in a bowl soup which is half tortilla & half split pea & barley along with one of their new small plates, a mushroom spinach flatbread. Very tasty. My sister had the beet & goat cheese salad which she liked, and my cousin had the Moroccan chicken salad without the chicken since she's a vegetarian! That's her favorite on the menu. Our server Kelly was excellent, she consistently filled up our iced tea & waters, brought our dishes out promptly and gave us to go cups for our drinks. The manager also came by to check on us to make sure we were enjoying our food. I've always liked CPK and their menu has expanded & is very good. I'll definitely be back!  Oh for dessert we had their seasonal pumpkin cheesecake which we split - scrumptious. Probably the best pumpkin cheesecake I've ever had. Highly recommend it. May see if I can order one for thanksgiving day, it was that good.

Haven't been back to this place for years. Finally went again. The pizza was good, the price is a bit high, the service is good. But it's not a place I would go back to regularly. It doesn't have that special feel, maybe because it's a chain.

The portions here are really big! The pizzas are enough to serve two people. They don't skimp on the toppings either. I ordered the chicken bbq salad and it was so good. The most delicious salad I've had.
Terrible service, asked to speak to manager about service but didnt seem to care. Will not recommend this place to anyone.

Unfortunately, the only closest CPK near my house and my son really loves it. I always seem to have something go wrong my orders every time I come in to dine or pick-up.  What really irked me today was that I called in my order,salmon and a side of avocado rolls, and the person that took my order said my order would be ready for pick up at 4:34pm. I came in at 4:35 and i was told my salmon had not even been placed in the oven. Disappointed, but the lady said, "we'll take care of the meal today; no charge", yet when she came back to give me the "credit" she still charged me $10+!!  Really??  I was so mad I chose to say nothing rather wait for my good. I didn't walk out until 14 minutes later.  Don't offer to take care of my bill if you're still going to charge for something!!

I came in on Saturday with my friend and was craving a particular pizza and was crushed to find out that it had been removed from the menu... i mentioned my disappointment to our server and immediately the manager, Art, came over and asked me what was on it so they could recreate it.... not only did he help me remember all the toppings on the pizza but i saw him physically go into the kitchen and help make it and he gave me a list of the ingredients for next time so i can order it again... now thats what i customer service!! I will definitely be coming back, thanks Art!!!

Usually when I come into Dallas, I hit my local small favs. However, this time, we all got together late, we were a large group, and had the small plate coupon. Anywho, there was quite a crowd already. The manager was up and about helping the staff.  My pops is capable of being short tempered, and sure enough, a bit slow to fill the drinks and tensions rose. Staff pulled together, helped each other out. The food was great, very friendly service. We were pleased with our experience. Thanks guys an gals!

Walked in at 3:30 and got sat immediately.  We were in a hurry to catch a movie so we were going to order right away. Unfortunately nobody came to our table to even serve us a drink.  We sat for 25 minutes and had to get up and leave and go somewhere else before our movie.  Good thing we left early.  Maybe 4 tables in the whole place had people seated so it wasn't busy at all.  2 couples got sat after us and served drinks while we sat and got no service.  Will never go back. Would not recommend.

Two stars for good service but the experience and food were not very good.  Food was over priced for what it was. I had the Kung Pao pasta...never again.  We arrived around 7:50. As we were finishing our food a man walked by and vacuumed the section we were in.  I was very disappointed.

We love CPK because it's family friendly, the service is friendly and the food is always delicious. This sunday I asked the manager what flavoring they used in the peach tea and he gave me a complimentary bottle of the Torani's peach flavoring.
Super friendly, clean and delicious food. Tracy was our server and she was awesome! Great suggestions and super personable!

They took such good care of us tonight with a crazy messy party of 11 (including 5 children). The seven year old birthday girl was treated like a rockstar and the management took care of a few minor oversights at the beginning of the evening with much grace!

CPK is a great place to take your kids and have a family meal.  I like this restaurant.  It's close to home, it's full of neighborhood kids hanging out in groups.  There are lots of booths and a great atmosphere.  I can see my kids going here on their own when they're older. Is this the place to get artisanal thin crust wood oven pizza?  No.  But it's a place that always brings a smile to my kids.  It's a casual and friendly place, bustling with young families, young adults and teenagers who are having a good time.  OK, it's not fine dining, or even an upscale restaurant but the decor is good, the service was friendly and the food and atmosphere fit the bill for a family dinner.  My kids love to come here so I'll give it 4 stars cause it works for my family.

Good place for kids.  That's it.  The lettuce in my chopped salad was wilted and the chicken in the salad tasted like pre-packaged frozen chicken.  The whole thing tasted like a below average airport salad.  The pasta dish tasted like play doe with garlic.  The bread at the table was good.  The service was slow and gave excuses that made no sense.  Don't tell me there was a slow down/hick-up in the kitchen when we can SEE that the kitchen wasn't even busy.  10 years ago this place was a worthy choice.  Today there are plenty of better choices in the area.  But to be really honest, a simple sandwich at the grocery store one block away would have been substantially better.

Austin gave us great service! He was very friendly, brought out our drinks correctly, the food was perfect and he even offered Togo cups at the end. As appetizers we ordered the lettuce wraps and a cup of baked potato soup. We ordered three pizzas , two of which were gluten free. All of them were delicious! Thank you CPK for being an awesome and delicious choice at Preston center!

Very nice and clean place with an attentive staff, we ordered the lettuce wraps for an appetizer it tasty & fresh. For our main course we had 2 sandwiches turkey and chicken with salads, everything was well prepared and beautiful presentation.

I dropped by on my lunch break, and ordered a pasta. The food is delicious, but the waiter seemed to not understand me when I asked for no cheese/dairy accommodations as I stay away from that.  Casual service, okay for a casual place like this.  The food is typical American cheese and bread kind of place but if you're looking to splurge, it's pretty delicious.

I give three start because flavor was good but way too over priced for the pizza size. I payed 17 bucks for a pizza that can only feed a child If you have money to spend and not planing to share your food then this is your spot.

The Alfredo pasta was spoiled and disgusting. I posted a photo in the gallery if you wanna see what I'm talking about. Would not recommend going here if you actually plan on eating. Also very overpriced.

Hadn't been here in a while. Morro can salad good but a bit overpriced. Server should get over himself but service was OK. Why would I not go back?  Weird air handlers all over the place and bathrooms are way upstairs and didn't have a light???? Not my California feel at all send me back to ventura Blvd or Brentwood!

Visited a couple months ago and were bummed they didn't have a vegan cheese option. My whole family ended up leaving and going to another pizza restaurant with better options. You should definitely tell corporate that your customers aren't settling for cheeseless pizza when there are tons of pizza chains that offer vegan cheese

This place is just your typical CPK. However, I'm really giving it three stars for the service and location. Pros: + Quick if you order take out + Spacious interior + Plenty of shops nearby if you want to check out different areas before or after dinner Cons: - Service is mediocre, especially if you order take out. They want you out as soon as possible without even taking a few minutes to properly package the food - Difficult to access - Parking near the restaurant is difficult to find.
Order to go for the family, pizza taste so good. Everybody loves it. Will be back in Mother's day !
Went here for our anniversary. The food is great. Anyone visiting should try the jambalaya pasta. You wont regret it!!

This is your typical CPK. Mom wanted to eat here for her birthday. Food is good but way overpriced for portion size. Service was mediocre and parking was terrible. 3 stars because I got what I expected.

I'm not a huge CPK fan but my young son had never been there and wanted to go. Atmosphere was clean and the staff very friendly. Not too loud or bright inside. It was a nice dinner setting. I selected the garlic fettuccine which wasn't all that impressive. Okay, but nothing stood out to me. My son ordered his favorite kind of pizza, BBQ Chicken. It was a small pizza that was more than enough for a 10 year old. The other guests at the table split the two salad which was delicious. Splitting it was a good idea considering the size was substantial. I think I might come back just for the tai salad.

Second time here, I love their pea soup so I ask for an Upgrade from a cup on the lunch menu to a bowl ,  but the only difference is the plate I call that stealing.  Not cool at all, I think someone needs to know this.  So before u upgrade  to a bigger soup make sure to know that the upgrade is NOT MORE SOUP IS A BIGGER PLATE.

Over the years I've gone to CPK off and on, however, these past 2-3 years my partner and I are regulars and actually like their food. As a foodie I've seen several restaurants fold and shut down over the years. This is due to the customer service and many of these restaurant chains just don't know how to dig themselves out of the hole. CPK has gone through their ups and downs. The key is to maintain profitability through outstanding customer service. I've been very observant over the years and noticed that CPK has changed with the way the market continuously changes. For CPK, its all about marketing. For example, their menus are very colorful with tasteful professional photos that literally make your mouth water when looking at some menu items. Not every dish is photographed BUT they know how to sell it on a visual level. I really like how they suggest a wine pairing with any of their main plates. Classy but not over the top. CUSTOMER SERVICE Then you have the human factor involved- the wait service. We usually request for Tracy S. who's been with CPK for many years at this particular location. She always makes our visit enjoyable and is a prime example of what every CPK server should be like- very attentive AND she knows her dishes very well. When observing her with other customers, she often would upsell items without pressuring them. She often makes suggestions and whether the customer would go with her suggestion or not, her verbal delivery is always professional and with a smile.  BEVERAGES I'm not a big drinker but I usually order my favorite Strawberry Mango Cooler. A refreshing beverage that is non-alcoholic. It's made of fresh strawberries hand-shaken with Fresca and Monin South Seas, featuring natural flavors of mango, guava and ginger. This drink definitely would go with any dish on their menu. APPETIZERS/SALAD Before our main course, we shared a Petite Wedge Salad which is topped with bleu cheese dressing, Nueske's applewood smoked bacon, chopped egg and Roma tomatoes. Tracy, our server, suggested that we get it chopped up and it sure was easier to split for sharing between two people.  MAIN COURSE This evening I ordered the Hearth-Roasted Halibut which is a wild-caught halibut caught in the Pacific Northwest, roasted on a cedar plank. The presentation is done very well with the halibut placed on top of a bed of grilled asparagus and creamy farro with butternut squash and baby kale. Absolute heaven in your mouth.  I tried this halibut dish when it was first showcased on their menu. When I took a bite out of it, the fish was over cooked. I didn't say anything to Tracy about this until months later when I decided to give this dish a try. It was obvious that the cooks really did not know how to cook this type of fish. Remember, not every fish is alike. Halibut is usually cooked for 20 minutes if closed on grill whereas cooking this fish on an open top would take 10 minutes. Keep in mind, salmon has been on their menu for quite sometime so I'm guessing the cooks used the same time to cook the halibut just like how they cook the salmon. So, on my second attempt with this halibut dish, my meal turned out beyond perfect. Even the manager, Michelle, came by to see if it was to my liking. You really don't get this type of attention and service in a casual restaurant.  My other half ordered the Cedar Planked Salmon which is North Atlantic salmon roasted on a cedar plank in our hearth oven with smoked paprika and lime. Served with white corn & spinach succotash and topped with Feta. He particularly likes the succotash and how it compliments the fish. Both fish dishes, the salmon and halibut, are cooked on a cedar plank which gives the fish a nice smoky cedar taste and really compliments the fish overall.  DESSERT To finish it off, we shared the Belgian Chocolate Souffle Cake topped off with a scoop of vanilla Hagen Das ice cream. Warm chocolate cake served with triple-thick hot fudge, housemade whipped cream and cacao nibs. Add a cup of coffee and you've got a perfect pairing. Excellent taste and nicely presented. OVERALL EXPERIENCE/SUGGESTIONS Overall, CPK has really cleaned up their act over the past 3-4 years. I like to see how these restaurants fight to stay afloat. I believe CPK corporate team is open minded to utilize at their front line employees (like their servers/wait staff) and allow them to grow by marketing catering services to local neighboring businesses. Very clever idea which you rarely see today.  As for my five star, well, they meet my expectations. There is definitely room for improvement. I like the fact that they are continuously and consistently updating their menu items introducing healthy dishes that many customers look experience. They also continue to market at all levels and like to hear feedback- this location in particular. Keep in mind, not all locations operate at a high level like this location in particular. Overall, great food and experience.

Late review The food seems standard with all the other CPK places. I really love their butter cake. One big problem I have with this place is the bathroom placement being on the second floor. It's quite inconvenient for me. Service was also a lil suboptimal.

chain store with extremely corporate regulated, coordinated, designed and executed food. however , i like the food. particularly caesar and peach salads and marquerita pizza. very dependable, clean with good service. i am always treated well in any cpk i choose. i really the preston center location for late lunch.
The gluten-free pizza crust is the best I've ever had! It's not that bland Udi's brand crust. It tastes great! Try the Gluten-free BBQ Chicken Pizza!

been at least quarterly for a decade and It's the best it's ever been. easy parking, dated decor but comfortable and clean. menu is reliable and good. trying to avoid grains at a pizza place- easily done with wide menu selection. well priced and efficient friendly service. best thing? even at the intersection of HP and Preston Hollow ball licking douchebaggery it is surprisingly absent here. yeah a few tired divorced moms trying to hold it together but overall a really pleasant crowd.

I love CPK! However this location the quality of food is really sub par to other locations.  On this Friday they were understaffed and you could tell they were over worked.  It all starting when 2 of our 3 glasses had dried food stuck on the glasses.  Following by 2 of 3 of you silverware had food stuck on them.  The pizzas we ordered were not balanced and flavorable. The recipes were not followed it was as if the pizzas were thrown together becAuse they didn't have time or just didn't care about the quality of food they were serving.   Kinda disappointing, especially for a restaurant that O love to eat at.
